review.title: Transformation of basic probability assignments to probabilities based on a new entropy measure
review.abstract: Dempster-Shafer evidence theory is an efficient mathematical tool to deal with uncertain information. In that theory, basic probability assignment (BPA) is the basic element for the expression and inference of uncertainty. Decision-making based on BPA is still an open issue in Dempster-Shafer evidence theory. In this paper, a novel approach of transforming basic probability assignments to probabilities is proposed based on Deng entropy which is a new measure for the uncertainty of BPA. The principle of the proposed method is to minimize the difference of uncertainties involving in the given BPA and obtained probability distribution. Numerical examples are given to show the proposed approach.

metadata.title: Transformation of basic probability assignments to probabilities based on a new entropy measure

sections.text: ar Xiv: 150 2.06 956v 1 [cs.A I] Dempster-Shafer Evidence Theory is an efficient mathematical tool for dealing with uncertain information. In this theory, the basic probability mapping (BPA) is the basic element for the expression and conclusion of uncertainty. Decision-making based on BPA is still an open problem in Dempster-Shafer Evidence Theory. In this paper, a novel approach is proposed to convert basic probability assignments into probabilities based on Deng entropy, which is a new measure of the uncertainty of BPA. The principle of the proposed method is to minimize the difference of uncertainties within the given BPA and achieve a probability distribution. Numerical examples are given to show the proposed approach. Keywords: Dempster-Shafer Evidence Theory, Faith Function, Deng-Mail Entropint, Xipint School Entropie, Southwest School Entropie, China Entropie: 26th February 2015.

sections.heading: 1. Introduction
sections.text: Dempster-Shafer Evidence Theory is widely used in many disciplines as it allows for dealing with uncertain information. Several familiar branches of its applications include statistical learning [1, 2, 3], classification and clustering [4, 5, 6, 7], decision making [8, 9, 10], epistemological logic [11, 12], risk assessment and assessment [13, 14, 15], and so on [16, 17, 18, 19, 20]. In Dempster-Shafer Evidence Theory, several major research directions are continually appealing to the attention of researchers, for example, the combination of multiple evidences [21, 22, 23], conflict management [24, 25], Basic Probability Assignment Generation (BPA), and so on [29, 30, 31]. Among these points, the decision-making based BPA model is a crucial question that needs to be resolved and it has attracted a lot of attention.

sections.heading: 2.1. Dempster-Shafer evidence theory
sections.text: Dempster Shafer Evidence Theory [40, 41], also called Dempster Shafer Theory or Evidence Theory, is used to deal with uncertain information. As an effective theory of the uncertainty principle, the Dempster Shafer Theory has the advantage of directly expressing various uncertainties, which requires weaker conditions than Bayesian probability theory, so it is often considered an extension of Bayesian theory. sections.heading: 3. Proposed probability transformation approach based on Deng
sections.text: Entropy This section first introduces a new measure of uncertainty in BPA, deng entropy, then proposes a new approach to converting BPA into probability distribution based on the concept of deng entropy.

sections.heading: 3.1. Deng entropy
sections.text: Deng entropy [39] is a generalized Shannon entropy for measuring the uncertainty associated with BPA. Mathematically, Deng entropy can be represented as follows: Ed = − ∑ im (Fi) log m (Fi) 2 | Fi | − 1 (7), where Fi is a clause in the mass function m, and | Fi | is the cardinality of Fi. As shown in the definition above, Deng entropy is formally similar to classical Shannon entropy, but the faith for each clause Fi is divided by a term (2 | Fi | − 1) representing the potential number of states in Fi (of course, the empty set is not included). In particular, Deng entropy can definitely degenerate into Shannon entropy if the faith is assigned only to individual elements.

sections.heading: 3.2. Proposed probability transformation approach
sections.text: In our view, a primary principle in the transformation process is to minimize the difference between the uncertainties associated with the given BPA and the obtained probability distribution. In order to implement such an optimization transformation, it must be able to calculate the uncertainty of the BPA. Strictly speaking, Deng entropy offers a method of measuring the uncertainty of the BPA as well as the probability distribution. sections.text: In this paper, the conversion of BPA into probability distribution was investigated, based on the idea that a novel probability transformation approach was proposed to minimize the difference between the uncertainties associated with the given BPA and the probability distribution obtained.
